results.name: Triangle read by rows, X^n * [1,0,0,0,...] where X = an infinite tridiagonal matrix with (1,0,1,0,1,...) in the main and subdiagonals and (1,1,1,...) in the subsubdiagonal.
example: First few rows of the triangle are;
program: def T(n,k):  # Triangle in centered form.
return T(n-1, k-1) + odd(n-k)*T(n-1, k) + even(n-k)*T(n-1, k+1)
for n in (0..7): [T(n,k) for k in (-n..n)]  # _Peter Luschny_, Nov 22 2013
xref: Cf. A007318 (Pascal's triangle), A140750, A000225 (row sums), A001405 (central terms).
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_ & _Roger L. Bagula_, May 26 2008
